intro: Elatostema umbellatum, commonly known as the umbrella elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants known for their stinging hairs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a waxy coating. Elatostema umbellatum produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbellate clusters, which are characteristic of its common name.
